Equivalence of sets of implications

Source: R/entails_equiv.R
grapes-twiddle-grapes.Rd

Equivalence of sets of implications

imps %~% imps2

Arguments

imps

A ImplicationSet.

imps2

Another ImplicationSet.

Value

TRUE of and only if imps and imps2

are equivalent, that is, if every implication in imps

follows from imps2 and viceversa.

Examples

fc <- FormalContext$new(planets)
fc$find_implications()
imps <- fc$implications$clone()
imps2 <- imps$clone()
imps2$apply_rules(c("simp", "rsimp"))
#> Processing batch
#> --> Simplification: from 10 to 10.
#> --> Right Simplification: from 10 to 10.
imps %~% imps2
#> [1] TRUE
imps %~% imps2[1:9]
#> [1] FALSE
